intro: Amaioua brevidentata, commonly known as the short-toothed amaioua, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with short, blunt teeth along the edges. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries. Amaioua brevidentata is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
